text:
I stumbled upon this bug while messing around in some PHP. I made a text area 
within a form, and for its default text I tried to include a php file. I tried 
this in hopes of being able to view the source of the page, via the page 
itself. When I tried to execute this script, Apache immediately crashed. I used 
the following code:

<TEXTAREA NAME=index ROWS=15 COLS=60><? include('./index.php'); ?></TEXTAREA>

I'm using PHP 4.3.3 via the module, not the executable.
creator: maxx709@hotmail.com
maxx709@hotmail.com
text:
I looked into this a bit further, and seem to have found the caues. Within the 
code of the page I'm trying to include, is an include() of the source page. So 
in effect, it's looping itself. Not sure if it's really a bug anymore, or just 
a bit of stupidity on my part.

regardless, not an Apache httpd problem in all likelihood

reopen if evidence surfaces of it being caused by a problem in Apache httpd

note that we don't handle suspected problems in PHP from this bug database
creator: trawick@apache.org
